articles.title: The 'Star Wars' Slur That Has Been Mainstreamed by Anti-AI Discourse
articles.summary: 'Star Wars' has had a contentious relationship with artificial intelligences for a very long timeâ€”and now that we find ourselves staring down the barrel of generative AI, the galaxy far, far away has given us the surprising language to denigrate it.

articles.title: Palantir Reports Sales Up 48%, Cites â€˜Astonishingâ€™ AI Impact
articles.summary:
Palantir Technologies Inc.Â reported a 48% increase in revenue for the second quarter to more than $1 billion, citing the â€œastonishing impactâ€ of artificial technology on its business. Â 
The data software company also raised its revenue outlook for the full year to $4.14 billion to $4.15 billion, exceeding analystsâ€™ prior expectation of $3.91 billion.Â 
The shares gained about 4% in extended trading after closing at $160.66 in New York. Denver-based Palantir has seen its stock price surge more than 500% over the past year â€” buoyed byÂ high expectations from investors, growth in demand for AI tools and a deep reach into both the private and public sectors. The companyâ€™s $1 billion revenue in the period ended June 30 exceeded analystsâ€™ average estimate of $939 million. It said growth was particularly strong in the US, where sales jumped 68% to $733 million. (Source: Bloomberg)

articles.title: Apple CEO Tells Staff AI 'Ours to Grab'
articles.summary: Apple Inc. Chief Executive Officer Tim Cook, holding a rare all-hands meeting following earnings results, rallied employees around the companyâ€™s artificial intelligence prospects and an â€œamazingâ€ pipeline of products. The executive gathered staff at Appleâ€™s on-campus auditorium Friday in Cupertino, California, telling them that the AI revolution is â€œas big or biggerâ€ as the internet, smartphones, cloud computing and apps. â€œApple must do this. Apple will do this. This is sort of ours to grab,â€ Cook told employees, according to people aware of the meeting. â€œWe will make the investment to do it.â€ The iPhone maker has been late to AI, debuting Apple Intelligence months after OpenAI, Alphabet Inc.â€™s Google, Microsoft Corp. and others flooded the market with products like ChatGPT. And when Apple finally released its AI tools, they fell flat. Bloomberg's Mark Gurman reports. (Source: Bloomberg)

articles.title: 'Bad Movies, Bad TV Shows, and a Lot of People Out of Work'
articles.summary: Oscar-nominated screenwriter Billy Ray is warning about the dangers that generative artificial intelligence represents to his industry. "The result will inevitably be chaos, bad movies, bad TV shows and a lot of people out of work," he warns
